meanings.definition: Kick (a football) from a stationary position on the ground, as in football or rugby.
meanings.sent1: He placekicked the football through the goalposts.
meanings.sent2: The player placekicked the ball for a field goal.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel placekicked the acorn into the tree hollow.
meanings.sent4: She placekicked her worries away with each kick of the ball.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the football being placekicked echoed across the field.

meanings.definition: Past tense and past participle of placekick.
meanings.sent1: He had placekicked the ball perfectly during practice.
meanings.sent2: She placekicked the ball further than anyone else on the team.
meanings.sent3: The cat placekicked the toy mouse around the room playfully.
meanings.sent4: The memories of his victories placekicked him into a state of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as he placekicked the winning goal.
